title: Banned for pretty much nothing.
body:
Going to start by saying i know there's people going to say wah wah you deserve it.. But i only started responding to what was being said to me, i had a singed top lane refusing to communicate telling me im a crappy jungler, with worse words, and a jinx bot lane saying and agreeing with everything he says, so i replied, and none of it was that bad. Now im banned for 2 weeks, fine ill take it. But at what point are you going to stop banning people for hurting other peoples feelings? Heres my chat log for my ban.

BigMacNoSauce: and killing 3 of them

https://www.leagueofgraphs.com/match/na/3308795288#participant6

My match history from that match. I tried my hardest to win. I got trash talked for being bronze 1. I defend myself gently not Harsh, and now im banned for 2 weeks for deciding not to sit there and take shit from people i dont know, telling me im trash, when im trying my best to win the match not only for me, but them aswell. Unjustly banned. But theres nothing i can do about it.

replies.body:
Didn't even read the chat.  All I needed to see was "I only responded to what was being said to me"

Ban 100% deserved.  GG no RE.

Its normal for people to respond to people. When people in real talk to you do you speak back to them? What happens when someone gets up in your face tells you your useless and you should kill yourself? I would say something back for sure. Whats the difference saying something back in the game?

> [{quoted}](name=BigMacNoSauce,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=foalNywj,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2020-02-27T17:23:35.219+0000)
>
> Its normal for people to respond to people. When people in real talk to you do you speak back to them? What happens when someone gets up in your face tells you your useless and you should kill yourself? I would say something back for sure. Whats the difference saying something back in the game?

No its not the same at all. LoL is a VIRTUAL online video game. It has nothing to do with self defense or honor or education or pride or justice system. When you play LoL, your physical integrity is not in danger. Heck, your personal honor is not even in danger either. Nobody forces you to defend yourself in a VIRTUAL game. You may say "I was educated to defend myself and my honor", which is great in some real life circumstances, useless in a virtual game with anonymous people.

Its hard to not want to retaliate, if it were easy, this Boards wouldnt exist neither this historical debate as old as LoL. Its hard to take the high road but thats the intelligent thing to do. Do you want to be the mature one or just another toxic player? Retaliation is useless, doesnt matter who started it in a virtual game.

All that being said, you have settings and tools to prevent you from flaming if you cant resist the urge. We can also assume you had chat restrictions before the 14d ban. We can also assume its not your first account, being so toxic on lvl35 Bronze account is rare. If you cannot respect the rules by controlling yourself + settings, then LoL is not meant for you and you shouldnt have a unhealthy interaction with a game. 

Lastly, after 14d ban, theres no leniency anymore. You are not required to be less toxic, you are required to be flawless. Meaning the smallest sign of negativity could trigger a permaban.

Your comment has absolutely no reason to be here, it makes no sense at all. Human beings reaction when someone speaks to them is to speak back. Get off your high horse. But your opinion is still welcome.
No, it's not. Your lack of self control is not a natural reaction. You are the one on this "high horse" where you think that your opinions/beliefs/attitudes are more important than everyone else's.

If you cant distinguish real world from virtual world, thats problematic. Also LoL is not a chat messenger app facebook group whatever. If you enjoy talking so much, do it on adequate platforms. You are not being punished for neutrally conversing, you are being punished for fueling negativity and aggravating disputes with sterile comments.
Human beings are also best equipped to control themselves when provoked, unlike every other living thing on the entire planet. You have poor self-control. You need to work on it.

> hyperion3182 
No its not the same at all. LoL is a VIRTUAL online video game. It has nothing to do with self defense or honor or education or pride or justice system. (and rest of post)

Mostly yes, but got to say that defense of the ego (reasonably done) is very relevant and should be done in most situations. Mind you, sometimes that entrails ignoring the offender, but that is only one way out of many, and for many people ignoring the threat to ego is not a good idea.

League does not care about this (it works against them making $ because a player defending themselves is not focused on the game) and good number of you who just wanna play the Goddamn game without whiners defending themselves don't wanna hear it. I know. That doesn't make it fair or good for those who would be better off defending themselves.

Of course, most people simply "go out of control" or some shit in defense, but there are reasonable ways to do so, and even rules-legal ways. How is not important to this thread. I do want an enjoyable game, and I believe to achieve that a greater respect for player's psyche is the key to unlocking a more competitive, player friendly base.

Right now the rules dictate "shut up about the toxic behavior, play the game, report them, and shut up about the toxic behavior."

Don't think that's for our benefit as players. It certainly suits many of you, dear apple-throwers, but Most people aren't like that, as apparent in the toxicity present in most games. The report system isn't being used rationally to identify foul rule-breaking. The rules are bending to the will of the masses to punish the most disliked.

Edit: OP is not exhibiting a good way to defend themselves, but the point of my response is to say that defending oneself is not against the rules and, done justly, is a good thing in the big picture, for the greater good of League rather than the isolated game.

Yeah the commentary really is not necessary. You get chat logs out of context (only your words) for a reason. Theres nothing anyone could say or do to you that would suddenly make you exempt from the rules.

You went wrong by implying your team is useless with all the "guess i gotta 1v5" shit. Started with singling out mid lane as the one "not paying attention" and then moved on to other players. Pretty condescending chat log. Not too bad, but you probably use chat like this often, and the system punishes based on severity and consistency. I would guess this is a case of consistent negative chat.

Ultimately, the system judges you on your behavior alone. Not based on the behavior of other people in your game. You spent some of your chat retaliating and there really isn't any need to join in on the flame war since it never helps.

Mute if you don't want to see their chat, report at the end of the game if you feel like Riot should look into their behavior. If you mute them, don't continue to talk about them.

Mate here is a helpful tip.


NEVER SAY ANYTHING IN CHAT, NEVER ARGUE.

You will get chat restrictions for arguing as that is considered  toxic behaviour. Trust me I argued in 1 game and got a 10game chat  restriction.


- All I do when someone's inting on purpose and refuses to ff is mute all. 

- Grab my phone 

- Watch Supernatural or suits.


You are better off not stressing over this game enjoy it and if it becomes toxic/ unenjoyable just go next.

Do not encourage others to break in-game rules.

Read up on the Universal Rules [here](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation/ITFIpNUE).

But i got punished, im in the wrong, ill take the ban. But my post is just my opinion and i like to hear from others about theirs too, mabey other people find them selves in similar situations.
